title: Biomass - common for heating and cooking in LDCs

content.question: Which of the following best describes the energy resource used most often for heating and cooking in less developed countries?

choices.label: Bituminous coal is primarily used because of its relative abundance and high moisture content.
Cogeneration from fuel oil systems is primarily used because it has low up-front costs.
Biomass is the predominant fuel source because it is easily obtained locally.
Natural gas is the most prevalent fuel source because it is readily available and produces few air pollutants.

content.answer: Biomass is the predominant fuel source because it is easily obtained locally.
